title: Let's talk about Jungle items.
body:
I've been maining jungle for about 2 seasons now, I'm sure that I'm not the only one that feels that there is a pretty large imbalance between the items.

{{item:3725}} Despite the nerfs that it's received, 25% extra bonus health is insane, the burn, even though much lower, is still very relevant too and it pushes out pretty much every other item.
{{item:3723}} The champs that would generally build this are bruisers and fighters, but in pretty much every situation, you're better off getting cinderhulk, the advantage of going warrior is a very nice early game power spike that rolls off in the late game (although you could simply switch to cinderhulk in the late game, and often times you're better off doing that.)
{{item:3724}} Feels fine, actually quite strong if you aren't needed to go the tanky route, I've heard that it's one of the most efficient items in the game and feels relevant throughout the entire game.
{{item:3726}} A really fun item that gets better as the game goes, but due to {{champion:19}} being so strong early in this season, this item received a substantial nerf (starts with 15 less damage on the passive, which is essentially 15 large monsters or 8 1/2 kills or assist)

I'm interested to know how the community feels about these items and the direction that riot should go with them, thanks in advance for your input!

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=Foxy FNAF,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=KE0b5it8,comment-id=00000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-06-12T23:15:31.076+0000)
>
> If it is so healthy why don't we see much ap junglers? And the ones we see are mostly cinder junglers.

AP Junglers are too blue buff dependent. Yet Blue buff remains best, in the hands of your mid laner. I may have taken an AP Jungler if our mid, was a Yasuo, a Vlad, a Zed, anyone who doesn't need the mana. Also because of AP midlaners, having magic heavy Junglers doesn't help round out the team comp. 

My Original though for magus was to give it the % mana restore on Kill/assist passive that Athene's has. Rewarding AP Junglers for a successful gank. But this works to. Also With RuneGlaives spellblade passive, Their might be even more mages that become viable for Jungling. Not Just Diana or ekko. 

Also, Cinderhulk isn't as dominant as it use to be. It's just a late game scaling item. While Warrior gives your the faster clear and the early damage. Choosing one over the other for no other purpose than when it spike is perfectly fine. And we have been seeing warrior on Rek'sai and Evelynn in the LCS.

The only thing Devourer needs is to not be reliant on AFK farming, As riot clearly does not support that tacktic. 

All in all, with CinderHulk and RuneGlaive I would predict that Warrior and Devourer will be looked at next. Probably reworked into something with a much cooler name.
Seems as though you and I share opinions and have the same decision making process for champ select, you managed to articulate my exact thoughts. Well done sir.
I've often thought Devourer would be better balanced by getting more stacks on kill/assist and by dealing its damage to towers.  It's gotta be the "carry from the jungle" item.

That might help, it would promote more ganking and less farming for the item, which is it's current issue. Leaving your jungle for the possibility of gaining 2 stacks (and all of the other benefits of ganking) look less appealing to someone wanting stacks than simply clearing and invading.
the magnus one is being changed (blue one) on the PBE to have a spellblade effect with it.

I don't see any notes for it so far posted for 5.12, can you list the changes? 

On a separate note, feels like riot is changing the one item that felt right >.>

The changes are on PBE so it is tenative and can change/not come out at all.

[Removed] Enchantment: Magus
Replaced by Enchantment: Runeglaive

[New Item] Enchantment: Runeglaive
Builds out of [Sheen + Jungle Item + 200g]
Stats:
40 AP
200 Mana
+10% Cooldown Reduction
UNIQUE Passive - Spellblade: After using an ability, the next basic attack is converted into magic damage and deals 75% Base Attack Damage (+30% of Ability Power) bonus magic damage on hit in an AoE around the target (1.5 second cooldown). When attacking a monster, this also restores 6% of your missing Mana."
Eh, I suppose it'll be good for certain champs, namely diana and probably ekko. Still feels like they're taking the healthiest one and changing it.
If it is so healthy why don't we see much ap junglers? And the ones we see are mostly cinder junglers.

> [{quoted}](name=Foxy FNAF,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=KE0b5it8,comment-id=00000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-06-12T23:15:31.076+0000)
>
> If it is so healthy why don't we see much ap junglers? And the ones we see are mostly cinder junglers.

Biggest reason being is AP casters need mana, and generally speaking, AP casters can't sustain themselves in the jungle due to heavy mana costs. Magnus is without a doubt, an incredibly cost efficient item, but unfortunately, there aren't many AP users with the kit needed to do well in the jungle and are viable in the current meta.

Kind of this, another issue is that most of them don't have sustain outside of shields. Blue buff naturally really shores up the issue of needing mana and also helps with cooldowns. The problem with the jungler needing blue buff is that if your jungler takes every blue buff, your mid can't push out as hard and roam, which leaves us with the idea that the only efficient time to have an AP Jungler is when we have a resourceless mid or an energy based mid, or someone that is simply really efficient, then you have to ask the question, does your team have enough bulk? So ideally you would need a team comp like Mao or Shen top, Zed mid, leona and an adc bot and then in these circumstances, you can strategically play an AP JG. This is a problem as well.
Healthy doesn't mean overpowered, cinderhulk will likely always be overpowered because of the 25% health, which overshadows this.
before cinder there was a different item in season 4 i believe that gave 25% as well.

You're referring to Spirit of the Ancient Golem, it had less health on it and a little bit of CDR (Which as a tank, you generally get 40% from other things without too much trouble.) The only real reason to buy that item was for the 25% health as the other two benefits (not counting the general jungle things) were pretty irrelevant. In the case of Cinderhulk, the 25% health is the reason to build it but the other things that come on it are fantastic.

tl:dr, the item gives quite a bit more, if you wanna go the route of spellblade on magus, buff warrior and devourer too.
